column4: What command shall I do to copy my linux / partition to another partition?
Could cp do the job properly?
My hard drive is faulty, got the SMART error, failure imminent etc etc
normally when I try I access the hard drive, the lil light on my box stays on and normally linux goes into read only mode
I'm not yet ready to accept it may be permanently f**ked, but im gonna move everything on the faulty hard drive to another hard drive and try and fix it another time
So.... rsync.... lemme take a look into this
take a look at Dirvish as well. It uses rsync and provides functionality on top of it
have no clue whether that's off-topic concerning your question =D
I think it's called "failsafe GNOME" or something.
